title: China coronavirus HORROR as thousands flout COVID-19 rules ahead of National Day holiday
text:
On Wednesday, a controversial video showed a packed out coach station in east China’s Hefei city. In the footage, a large swarm is seen waiting to enter the facility with no social distancing.

Trending

It comes ahead of China’s National Day holiday due to take place today.

The beginning of the holiday was met with similar images in other parts of the country.

People across Chinese cities are preparing for the eight-day holiday, which one of the country’s busiest holidays of the year.

The event is expected to attract tourism, with Chinese travel booking platform Ctrip estimating more than 600million trips during the entire holiday.



Chinese President Xi Jinping

Alarming images such as yesterday’s were also seen in former coronavirus hotspot Wuhan, where motorists were spotted stuck in long queues of traffic for hours. Earlier this year, China’s state media came under fire after backing a mass pool party in Wuhan. Images that went viral on social media last August showed a jam-packed swimming pool that caused a potential threat of mass spread of coronavirus. Footage of the music festival, which took place at the Wuhan Maya Beach Water Park on July 11, revellers stood shoulder-to-shoulder with no room for social distancing. The waiting hall of Hangzhou East Railway Station in August

The vital importance of social distancing

The images of partygoers on inflatable ring eventually went viral, sparking outrage globally. But furious Twitter users pointed out the lack of social distancing and the high risk of infection. One user wrote: "Wuhan China is currently having massive gatherings, pool parties and life is going on as usual." Another added: "Looks like Wuhan forgot about the coronavirus..." And a third person said: "This is #Wuhan, #China. Where the #COVID19 originated from. No social distancing. What a joke!"
